data.question: What is the empirical formula of compound 1?
What crystal system and space group does compound 1 belong to?
What is the calculated density of compound 1?
How many unique reflections were collected for compound 1 and what was the completeness to theta = 19.98?
data.answer: 1702 unique reflections were collected with a completeness of 92.0%

data.question: What are the final R indices for compound 1 when I>2sigma(I)?
Based on the synthesis conditions, what type of building blocks were used to construct compound 1?
data.answer: Simple molecular building blocks (MBBs) and supermolecular building blocks (SBBs) were used.

data.question: What is the significance of the 5-position of the isophthalate ligands in the construction of compound 1?
data.answer: The 5-position of the isophthalate ligands sits directly on the vertices of the rhombicuboctahedron, serving as the tertiary building unit (TBU) for the construction of compound 1.

data.question: How does the solvothermal reaction between 5-tetrazolylisophthalic acid and Cu(NO3)2Â·2.5H2O contribute to the formation of compound 1?
data.answer: The solvothermal reaction yields a homogeneous crystalline material, which upon characterization was identified as compound 1, indicating the successful assembly of the designed MOF.

data.question: Is the crystal structure of compound 1 based on a ternary net topology?
Does the structure of compound 1 offer potential for gas storage applications?
Is the (3,24)-connected rht net the only edge transitive net known for the assembly of 24- and 3-connected vertices?
Can the connectivity in compound 1 be alternatively interpreted to be related to inorganic zeolite A with lta topology?
Was the Cu3O(N4CR)3 trimer previously observed in tetrazolate ligands before the synthesis of compound 1?
Is the total solvent-accessible volume for compound 1 estimated to be approximately 50%?
Does the structure of compound 1 include a (3,3,4)-connected ternary net based on the assembly of three different basic SBUs?
